intro: Dampiera loranthifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a woody stem and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Dampiera loranthifolia is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to arid conditions.
